original: Milindapañha
analyzed: milindapañha
translated: The Questions of King Milinda

original: Bāhirakathā🔽1. Pubbayogādi
analyzed: bāhira kathā  pubba yoga ādi
translated: The External Story🔽The previous effort, etc.

original: Pubbayogoti tesaṁ pubbakammaṁ.
analyzed: pubba yogaḥ ti tesam pubba kamma
translated: The previous effort is their previous kamma.

original: Atīte kira kassapassa bhagavato sāsane vattamāne gaṅgāya samīpe ekasmiṁ āvāse mahābhikkhusaṅgho
analyzed: atīte kira kassapassa bhagavato sāsane vattamāne gaṅgāya samīpe ekasmin āvāse mahā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ
translated: In the past, it seems, in the dispensation of the Blessed One Kassapa, a large community of bhikkhus was living in a certain monastery near the river Ganges.

original: paṭivasati, tattha vattasīlasampannā bhikkhū pātova uṭṭhāya yaṭṭhisammajjaniyo ādāya
analyzed: paṭivasati tattha vatta sīla sampannāḥ bhikkhū pātova uṭṭhāya yaṭṭhi sammajjaniyaḥ ādāya
translated: There the bhikkhus who were perfect in virtue rose early and taking their walking sticks and their bamboo scrapers,

original: buddhaguṇe āvajjentā aṅgaṇaṁ sammajjitvā kacavarabyūhaṁ karonti.🔽Atheko bhikkhu ekaṁ sāmaṇeraṁ “ehi, sāmaṇera, imaṁ kacavaraṁ chaḍḍehī”ti—
analyzed: buddha guṇe āvajjentāḥ aṅgaṇam sammajjitvā kacavara byūham karonti  atha ekaḥ bhikkhu ekam sāmaṇeram ehi sāmaṇera imam kaca varam chaḍḍehi iti
translated: they swept out the yards, recollecting the special qualities of the Buddha.🔽Then one bhikkhu said to a novice, “Come, novice, throw this rubbish out.”

original: āha, so asuṇanto viya gacchati, so dutiyampi …
analyzed: āha saḥ a suṇantaḥ viya gacchati saḥ dutiyam pi
translated: The novice went as if he had not heard. The bhikkhu said it a second time,

original: tatiyampi āmantiyamāno asuṇanto viya gacchateva.
analyzed: tatiyam pi āmantiyamānaḥ a suṇantaḥ viya gacchatā iva
translated: and a third time the novice went as if he had not heard.

original: Tato so bhikkhu “dubbaco vatāyaṁ sāmaṇero”ti kuddho sammajjanidaṇḍena pahāraṁ adāsi.🔽Tato so rodanto bhayena kacavaraṁ chaḍḍento “iminā kacavarachaḍḍanapuññakammena yāvāhaṁ
analyzed: tatas saḥ bhikkhu dubbacaḥ vata ayam sāmaṇeraḥ iti kuddhaḥ sammajjani daṇḍena pahāram adāsi 🔽tatas saḥ rodantaḥ bhayena kaca varam chaḍḍentaḥ iminā kaca vara chaḍḍana puñña kammena yāva āha
translated: Then the bhikkhu thought, “This novice is ill-bred,” and in his anger he struck him with the scraper handle.🔽The novice threw out the rubbish, crying with fear, “By this merit of throwing out the rubbish, may I be reborn in the world of the gods.

original: nibbānaṁ pāpuṇāmi, etthantare nibbattanibbattaṭṭhāne majjhanhikasūriyo viya mahesakkho
analyzed: nibbānam pāpuṇāmi etthantare nibbatta nibbatta ṭhāne majjhanhika sūriyaḥ viya mahesakkhaḥ
translated: “Wherever I’m reborn in the time before reaching Nibbāna, may I be very powerful and glorious,

original: mahātejo bhaveyyan”ti—
analyzed: mahā tejaḥ
translated: like the midday sun.”

original: paṭhamaṁ patthanaṁ paṭṭhapesi.
analyzed: paṭhamam patthanam paṭṭhapesi
translated: This was his first aspiration.

original: Kacavaraṁ chaḍḍetvā nahānatthāya gaṅgātitthaṁ gato gaṅgāya ūmivegaṁ gaggarāyamānaṁ
analyzed: kaca varam chaḍḍetvā nahāna tthāya gaṅgātittham gataḥ gaṅgāya ūmi vegam gaggarāyamāna
translated: After throwing away the grass, he went to the bank of the Ganges to bathe. He saw the Ganges with its waves and whirlpools.

original: disvā “yāvāhaṁ nibbānaṁ pāpuṇāmi, etthantare nibbattanibbattaṭṭhāne ayaṁ ūmivego
analyzed: disvā yāvā aham nibbānam pāpuṇāmi etthantare nibbatta nibbatta ṭhāne ayam ūmi vegaḥ
translated: “Wherever I’m reborn in the time before reaching Nibbāna, may I be very powerful and glorious,

original: viya ṭhānuppattikapaṭibhāno bhaveyyaṁ akkhayapaṭibhāno”ti—
analyzed: viya ṭhānuppattika paṭibhānaḥ bhaveyyam akkhaya paṭibhānaḥ ti
translated: like the waves of the Ganges. May I be inexhaustible in my eloquence.”

original: dutiyampi patthanaṁ paṭṭhapesi.
analyzed: dutiyam pi patthanam paṭṭhapesi
translated: This was his second aspiration.

original: Sopi bhikkhu sammajjanisālāya sammajjaniṁ ṭhapetvā nahānatthāya gaṅgātitthaṁ gacchanto
analyzed: saḥ api bhikkhu sammajjani sālāya sammajjanim ṭhapetvā nahāna tthāya gaṅgātittham gacchantaḥ
translated: After putting the broom in the cleaning shed, that monk went to the bank of the Ganges to bathe.

original: sāmaṇerassa patthanaṁ sutvā “esa mayā payojitopi tāva evaṁ pattheti, mayhaṁ kiṁ na samijjhissatī”ti—
analyzed: sāmaṇerassa patthanam sutvā esa mayā payojitaḥ api tāva evam pattheti mayham kim na samijjhissati iti
translated: After hearing the novice’s aspiration, he thought, “He, who was employed by me, has made such an aspiration. Why shouldn’t I be successful?”🔽“Wherever I’m reborn in the time before reaching Nibbāna, may I be very powerful and glorious,

original: cintetvā “yāvāhaṁ nibbānaṁ pāpuṇāmi, etthantare nibbattanibbattaṭṭhāne ayaṁ gaṅgāūmivego
analyzed: cintetvā yāvā aham nibbānam pāpuṇāmi etthantare nibbatta nibbatta ṭṭhāne ayam gaṅgā ūmi vegaḥ
translated: like the waves of the Ganges.

original: viya akkhayapaṭibhāno bhaveyyaṁ, iminā pucchitapucchitaṁ sabbaṁ pañhapaṭibhānaṁ vijaṭetuṁ
analyzed: viya akkhaya paṭibhānaḥ bhaveyya iminā pucchita pucchitam sabbam pañha paṭibhānam vijaṭetu
translated: and that I might have inexhaustible eloquence, and that I might be able to unravel and explain all the questions that might be asked

original: nibbeṭhetuṁ samattho bhaveyyan”ti—
analyzed: nibbeṭhetum samatthaḥ bhaveyyanti
translated: by answering them one by one”

original: patthanaṁ paṭṭhapesi.
analyzed: patthanam paṭṭhapesi
translated: he made his aspiration.

original: Te ubhopi devesu ca manussesu ca saṁsarantā ekaṁ buddhantaraṁ khepesuṁ.
analyzed: te ubho api devesu ca manussesu ca sasarantaḥ ekam buddha antaram khepesu
translated: Both of them, transmigrating among gods and humans, passed by one Buddha-interval.

original: Atha amhākaṁ bhagavatāpi yathā moggaliputtatissatthero dissati, evametepi dissanti
analyzed: atha amhākam bhagavatā api yathā moggaliputta tissa theraḥ dissati evam ete api dissanti
translated: Then, just as the Elder Moggaliputtatissa is seen by our Lord, so were these two seen🔽by the Lord Buddha Kassapa. He said: “Five hundred years after my Parinibbāna, these two will arise. The Dhamma and Discipline

original: mama parinibbānato pañcavassasate atikkante ete uppajjissanti, yaṁ mayā sukhumaṁ🔽katvā desitaṁ dhammavinayaṁ, taṁ ete pañhapucchanaopammayuttivasena nijjaṭaṁ niggumbaṁ
analyzed: mama parinibbānataḥ pañca vassa sate atikkante ete uppajjissanti yam mayā  katvā desitam dhamma vinaya tam ete pañha pucchana opamma yutti vasena nijjaṭam niggumba
translated: taught by me, which is subtle,🔽they will analyse and explain, removing the hair-splitting and the quibbles, by means of the ninety-six modes of answering questions.”

original: katvā vibhajissantīti niddiṭṭhā.
analyzed: katvā vibhajissanti iti niddiṭṭhā
translated: Thus he predicted them.

original: Tesu sāmaṇero jambudīpe sāgalanagare milindo nāma rājā ahosi.
analyzed: tesu sāmaṇeraḥ jambudīpe sāgala nagare milindaḥ nāma rājā ahosi
translated: Of these two, the novice monk was King Milinda in the city of Sāgala in the Rose-Apple Island.

original: Paṇḍito byatto medhāvī paṭibalo atītānāgatapaccuppannānaṁ mantayogavidhānakiriyānaṁ, karaṇakāle nisammakārī hoti, bahūni cassa satthāni uggahitāni honti.
analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ byattaḥ medhāvī paṭibalaḥ atīta anāgata paccuppannānam karaṇa kāle nisamma kārī hoti bahūni ca satthāni uggahitāni honti
translated: He was wise, clever, intelligent, and able to understand the meaning of what was said in the past, future, and present. He was a man of few words, and he had learned many treatises.

original: Seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: seyyathida
translated: They were:

original: suti sammuti saṅkhyā yogā nīti visesikā gaṇikā gandhabbā tikicchā catubbedā purāṇā
analyzed: suti sammuti saṅkhyā yogā nīti visesikā gaṇikā gandhabbā tikicchā catubbedā purāṇā
translated: the Vedas, the Sammuti, the Saṅkhyā, the Yoga, the Nīti, the Visesikā, the Gaṇikā, the Gandhabbā, the Tikicchā, the Catubbedā, the Purāṇā,

original: itihāsā jotisā māyā ketu mantanā yuddhā chandasā buddhavacanena ekūnavīsati, vitaṇḍavādī
analyzed: itihāsā jotisā māyā ketu mantanā yuddhā chandasā buddhavacanena ekūnavīsati vitaṇḍa vādī
translated: the Itihāsā, the Jotisā, the Māyā, the Ketu, the Mantana, the Yuddha, the Chandas, and the Buddhavacana. He was a debater.

original: durāsado duppasaho puthutitthakarānaṁ aggamakkhāyati, sakalajambudīpe milindena raññā
analyzed: durāsadaḥ duppasahaḥ puthu titthakarānam aggam akkhāyati sakala jambudīpe milindena raññā
translated: He was unapproachable and invincible, and he was considered the foremost of the various sectarians. In all of India there was no one equal to King Milinda

original: samo koci nāhosi yadidaṁ thāmena javena sūrena paññāya, aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo anantabalavāhano.
analyzed: samaḥ koci na ahosi yat idam thāmena javena sūrena paññāya aḍḍhaḥ mahat dhanaḥ mahā bhogo ananta bala vāhanaḥ
translated: in height, speed, courage, and wisdom. He was rich, very wealthy, and had an infinite army and vehicles.

original: Athekadivasaṁ milindo rājā anantabalavāhanaṁ caturaṅginiṁ balaggasenābyūhaṁ dassanakamyatāya
analyzed: atha eka divasam milindaḥ rājā ananta balavāhanam caturaṅginim balagga senā byūham dassana kamyatāya
translated: One day King Milinda, desiring to see his infinite army and vehicles,

original: nagarā nikkhamitvā bahinagare senaṅgadassanaṁ katvā sāretvā so rājā bhassappavādako
analyzed: nagarā nikkhamitvā bahi nagare senaṅga dassanam katvā sāretvā saḥ rājā bhassa ppavādakaḥ
translated: After leaving the city and seeing the army outside the city, and after sending it back, that King Milinda, who was a slanderer,

original: lokāyatavitaṇḍajanasallāpaplavacittakotūhalo visārado vijambhako sūriyaṁ oloketvā amacce āmantesi—🔽“bahu bhaṇe tāva divasāvaseso kiṁ karissāma, idāneva nagaraṁ pavisitvā atthi koci
analyzed: lokāyata vitaṇḍa jana sallāpa plava citta kotūhalaḥ visāradaḥ vijambhakaḥ sūriyam oloketvā amacce āmantesi  bahu bhaṇe tāva divasa avasesaḥ kim karissāma idānā iva nagaram pavisitvā atthi koci
translated: who was confused by the chatter of people who were skilled in worldly speculation, who was confident, who was a braggart, who looked at the sun, addressed his ministers, saying:

original: paṇḍito samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā saṅghī gaṇī gaṇācariyo api arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ
analyzed: paṇḍitaḥ samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā saṅghī gaṇī gaṇa ācariyaḥ api arahantam sammāsambuddha
translated: “There is still much of the day left, what should we do? Let us enter the city now. Is there any wise man, whether he is a monk or a brahmin, who is a leader of a community, a leader of a group, a teacher of a group, who claims to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha,

original: paṭijānamāno, yo mayā saddhiṁ sallapituṁ sakkoti kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinetuṁ, taṁ upasaṅkamitvā
analyzed: paṭijānamānaḥ yaḥ mayā saddhim sallapitum sakkoti kaṅkham paṭivinetu tam upasaṅkamitvā
translated: with whom I can converse and who can remove my doubts? Let us approach him

original: pañhaṁ pucchissāma, kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinayissāmā”ti.
analyzed: pañham pucchissāma kaṅkham paṭivinayissāma ati
translated: and ask him a question, let us remove our doubts.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, pañcasatā yonakā rājānaṁ milindaṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: evam vutte pañca satāḥ yonakāḥ rājānam milindam etat avocuḥ
translated: When this was said, the five hundred young men said this to King Milinda:

original: “atthi, mahārāja, cha satthāro pūraṇo kassapo makkhaligosālo nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto sañjayo
analyzed: atthi mahā rāja cha satthāraḥ pūraṇaḥ kassapaḥ makkhali gosālaḥ nigaṇṭhaḥ nāṭa putto sañjayo
translated: “Your Majesty, there are six teachers: Pūraṇa Kassapa, Makkhali Gosāla, Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta, Sañjaya

original: belaṭṭhaputto ajito kesakambalo pakudho kaccāyano, te saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyakā
analyzed: belaṭṭha putto ajitaḥ kesakambalaḥ pakudhaḥ kaccāyano te saṅghinaḥ gaṇinaḥ gaṇa ācariyakā
translated: Ajita, the son of a Kesi, and Pakudha Kaccāyana, they are leaders of communities, leaders of groups, teachers of groups,

original: ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa, gaccha tvaṁ, mahārāja, te pañhaṁ
analyzed: ñātāḥ yasassinaḥ titthakarāḥ sādhu sammatāḥ bahu janassa gaccha tva mahā rāja te pañha
translated: they are well-known, famous, leaders of sects regarded as holy by many people, go, Great King, ask them your questions,

original: pucchassu, kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinayassū”ti.
analyzed: pucchassu kaṅkham paṭivinayassu iti
translated: and have your doubts resolved.”

original: Atha kho milindo rājā pañcahi yonakasatehi parivuto bhadravāhanaṁ rathavaramāruyha
analyzed: atha khalu milindaḥ rājā pañcahi yonaka satehi parivutaḥ bhadravāhanam ratha varam āruyha
translated: Then King Milinda, surrounded by five hundred young men, mounted his fine bejewelled chariot,

original: yena pūraṇo kassapo tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā pūraṇena kassapena saddhiṁ sammodi,
analyzed: yena pūraṇaḥ kassapo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā pūraṇena kassapena saddhim sammodi
translated: and approached Pūraṇa Kassapa, and after approaching and worshipping Pūraṇa Kassapa,

original: sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi, ekamantaṁ nisinno kho
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho
translated: and after exchanging polite and courteous greetings, sat down on one side, and while sitting on one side

original: milindo rājā pūraṇaṁ kassapaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: milindaḥ rājā pūraṇam kassapam etat avoca
translated: King Milinda said this to Pūraṇa Kassapa:

original: “ko, bhante kassapa, lokaṁ pāletī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ bhante kassapa lokam pāleti iti
translated: “What, reverend Kassapa, supports the world?”

original: “Pathavī, mahārāja, lokaṁ pāletī”ti.
analyzed: pathavī mahā rāja lokam pāla iti iti
translated: “The earth, Great King, supports the world.”

original: “Yadi, bhante kassapa, pathavī lokaṁ pāleti, atha kasmā avīcinirayaṁ gacchantā sattā pathaviṁ atikkamitvā gacchantī”ti?
analyzed: yadi bhante kassapa pathavī lokam pāleti atha kasmai avīci nirayam gacchantā sattā pathavim atikkamitvā gacchanti iti
translated: “If, reverend Kassapa, the earth supports the world, then why do beings who are going to the Avīci hell, after passing over the earth, go (to hell)?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, pūraṇo kassapo neva sakkhi ogilituṁ, no sakkhi uggilituṁ, adhomukho pattakkhandho tuṇhībhūto pajjhāyanto nisīdi.
analyzed: evam vutte pūraṇaḥ kassapaḥ na iva sakkhi ogilitu no sakkhi uggilitu adhomukhaḥ patta kkhandhaḥ tuṇhībhūtaḥ pajjhāyantaḥ nisīdi
translated: When this was said, Pūraṇa Kassapa was unable to stand, and he sat down again, with his head hanging low, brooding, and speechless.

original: Atha kho milindo rājā makkhaliṁ gosālaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu milindaḥ rājā makkhalim gosālam etat avoca
translated: Then King Milinda said to the Ājīvika Gosāla:

original: “atthi, bhante gosāla, kusalākusalāni kammāni, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṁ kammānaṁ phalaṁ vipāko”ti?
analyzed: atthi bhante gosāla kusala akusalāni kammāni atthi su kata dukkaṭānam kammānam phalam vipāko ti
translated: “Reverend Gosāla, are there good and bad actions, and is there fruit and result of good and bad actions?”

original: “Natthi, mahārāja, kusalākusalāni kammāni, natthi sukatadukkaṭānaṁ kammānaṁ phalaṁ vipāko.
analyzed: natthi mahā rāja kusala akusalāni kammāni natthi su kata dukkaṭānam kammānam phalam vipākaḥ
translated: “Great king, there are no good or bad actions, and there is no fruit and result of good or bad actions.

original: Ye te, mahārāja, idha loke khattiyā, te paralokaṁ gantvāpi puna khattiyāva bhavissanti,🔽ye te brāhmaṇā vessā suddā caṇḍālā pukkusā, te paralokaṁ gantvāpi puna brāhmaṇā vessā
analyzed: ye te mahā rāja idha loke khattiyā te para lokam gantvā api puna khattiyā ava bhavissanti  ye te brāhmaṇāḥ vessāḥ suddāḥ caṇḍālāḥ pukkusāḥ te para lokam gantvā api punar brāhmaṇāḥ vessāḥ
translated: Those who in this world are nobles, they will become nobles again in the next world;

original: suddā caṇḍālā pukkusāva bhavissanti.
analyzed: suddā caṇḍālā pukkusā va bhavissanti
translated: those who are brahmins, merchants, workers, outcastes, or scavengers, they will become outcastes or scavengers again in the next world.

original: Kiṁ kusalākusalehi kammehī”ti?
analyzed: kim kusala akusalehi kammehi iti
translated: What is the use of good and bad actions?”

original: “Yadi, bhante gosāla, idha loke khattiyā brāhmaṇā vessā suddā caṇḍālā pukkusā, te
analyzed: yadi bhante gosāla idha loke khattiyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vessā suddā caṇḍālā pukkusā te
translated: “Reverend Gosāla, if in this world there are nobles, brahmins, merchants, workers, outcastes, and scavengers,

original: paralokaṁ gantvāpi puna khattiyā brāhmaṇā vessā suddā caṇḍālā pukkusāva bhavissanti,
analyzed: para lokam gantvā api puna khattiyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vessāḥ suddāḥ caṇḍālāḥ pukkusāḥ va bhavissanti
translated: even after going to the other world, they will be reborn as nobles, brahmins, merchants, workers, outcastes, or scavengers.

original: natthi kusalākusalehi kammehi karaṇīyaṁ.
analyzed: natthi kusala akusalehi kammehi karaṇīya
translated: There is nothing to be done by way of skillful or unskillful deeds.

original: Tena hi, bhante gosāla, ye te idha loke hatthacchinnā, te paralokaṁ gantvāpi puna hatthacchinnāva bhavissanti.
analyzed: tena hi bhante gosāla ye te idha loke hattha chinnā te para lokam gantvā api puna hattha chinnā ava bhavissanti
translated: “Well then, Reverend Gosāla, those in this world who are handless will, after going to the other world, be reborn as those who are handless.

original: Ye pādacchinnā, te pādacchinnāva bhavissanti.🔽Ye hatthapādacchinnā, te hatthapādacchinnāva bhavissanti.
analyzed: ye pāda chinnā te pāda chinnāḥ ava bhavissanti  ye hattha pāda chinnā te hattha pāda chinnā ava bhavissanti
translated: Those who are footless will be reborn as those who are footless.🔽Those who are handless and footless will be reborn as those who are handless and footless.

original: Ye kaṇṇacchinnā, te kaṇṇacchinnāva bhavissanti.
analyzed: ye kaṇṇacchinnā te kaṇṇacchinnā ava bhavissanti
translated: Those who are earless will be reborn as those who are earless.

original: Ye nāsacchinnā, te nāsacchinnāva bhavissanti.
analyzed: ye te bhavissanti
translated: Those who are noseless will be reborn as those who are noseless.

original: Ye kaṇṇanāsacchinnā, te kaṇṇanāsacchinnāva bhavissantī”ti.
analyzed: ye te kaṇṇanāsacchinnā ava bhavissanti iti
translated: Those who are earless and noseless will be reborn as those who are earless and noseless.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, gosālo tuṇhī ahosi.
analyzed: evam vutte gosālaḥ tuṇhī ahosi
translated: When this was said, Gosāla was silent.

original: Atha kho milindassa rañño etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho milindassa raññaḥ etat ahosi
translated: Then King Milinda thought:

original: “tuccho vata bho jambudīpo, palāpo vata bho jambudīpo, natthi koci samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā, yo mayā saddhiṁ sallapituṁ sakkoti kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinetun”ti.
analyzed: tucchaḥ vata bho jambudīpo palāpaḥ vata bho jambudīpo na atthi koci samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā yaḥ mayā saddhim sallapitum sakkoti kaṅkham paṭivinetunti
translated: “The Rose-Apple Island is empty, the Rose-Apple Island is empty, there is no ascetic or brāhmaṇa who can converse with me and resolve my doubts.”

original: Atha kho milindo rājā amacce āmantesi—
analyzed: atha khalu milindaḥ rājā amacce āmantesi
translated: Then King Milinda addressed his ministers, saying:

original: “ramaṇīyā vata bho dosinā ratti, kaṁ nu khvajja samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā upasaṅkameyyāma pañhaṁ pucchituṁ, ko mayā saddhiṁ sallapituṁ sakkoti kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinetun”ti?
analyzed: ramaṇīyā vata bho dosinā ratti kam nu khvajja samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā upasaṅkameyyāma pañham pucchitu kaḥ mayā saddhim sallapitum sakkoti kaṅkham paṭivinetunti
translated: “Delightful, indeed, is this moonlit night, whom shall we visit today, an ascetic or a brāhmaṇa, to ask him a question? Who can converse with me and resolve my doubts?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, amaccā tuṇhībhūtā rañño mukhaṁ olokayamānā aṭṭhaṁsu.
analyzed: evam vutte amaccā tuṇhībhūtāḥ raññaḥ mukham olokayamānāḥ aṭṭhasu
translated: When this was said, the ministers stood there in silence, looking at the king’s face.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sāgalanagaraṁ dvādasa vassāni suññaṁ ahosi samaṇabrāhmaṇagahapatipaṇḍitehi,
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sāgala nagaram dvādasa vassāni suññam ahosi samaṇa brāhmaṇa gahapati paṇḍitehi
translated: Now at that time the city of Sāgala had been empty for twelve years of ascetics, brāhmaṇas, householders and wise men,

original: yattha samaṇabrāhmaṇagahapatipaṇḍitā paṭivasantīti suṇāti, tattha gantvā rājā te
analyzed: yattha samaṇa brāhmaṇa gahapati paṇḍitā paṭivasanti iti suṇāti tattha gantvā rājā te
translated: and wherever he heard that ascetics, brāhmaṇas, householders and wise men were living, the king went there

original: pañhaṁ pucchati, te sabbepi pañhavisajjanena rājānaṁ ārādhetuṁ asakkontā yena vā tena vā pakkamanti.
analyzed: pañham pucchati te sabbe api pañha visajjanena rājānam ārādhetum a sakkontāḥ yena vā tena vā pakkamanti
translated: and asked them a question, and all of them were unable to satisfy the king by answering his question, and they went away this way and that.

original: Ye aññaṁ disaṁ na pakkamanti, te sabbe tuṇhībhūtā acchanti.
analyzed: ye aññam disam na pakkamanti te sabbe tuṇhībhūtāḥ acchanti
translated: But those who did not go to other directions all remained silent.

original: Bhikkhū pana yebhuyyena himavantameva gacchanti.
analyzed: bhikkhū pana yebhuyyena himavantam eva gacchanti
translated: But most of the monks went to the Himalayas.

original: Tena kho pana samayena koṭisatā arahanto himavante pabbate rakkhitatale paṭivasanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena koṭi satāḥ arahantaḥ himavante pabbate rakkhita tale paṭivasanti
translated: At that time, a hundred and twenty thousand perfected ones were living on the Rakkhita Plateau in the Himalayas.

original: Atha kho āyasmā assagutto dibbāya sotadhātuyā milindassa rañño vacanaṁ sutvā yugandharamatthake bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātetvā bhikkhū pucchi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmat assaguttaḥ dibbāya sotadhātuyā milindassa rañño vacanam sutvā yugandhara matthake bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātetvā bhikkhū pucchi
translated: Then, having heard King Milinda’s words with his divine ear, Venerable Assagutta gathered the Sangha of monks on the Yugandhara Peak and asked the monks,

original: “atthāvuso koci bhikkhu paṭibalo milindena raññā saddhiṁ sallapituṁ kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinetun”ti?
analyzed: attha āvuso koci bhikkhu paṭibalaḥ milindena raññā saddhim sallapitum kaṅkham paṭivinetum
translated: “Is there any monk who is able to converse with King Milinda and resolve his doubts?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, koṭisatā arahanto tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
analyzed: evam vutte koṭi satāḥ arahantaḥ tuṇhī ahesu
translated: When this was said, the hundred and twenty thousand perfected ones remained silent.

original: Dutiyampi …
analyzed: dutiyam pi
translated: A second time …

original: tatiyampi puṭṭhā tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
analyzed: tatiyam pi puṭṭhā tuṇhī ahesu
translated: A third time he asked, and they remained silent.

original: Atha kho āyasmā assagutto bhikkhusaṅghaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai assaguttaḥ bhikkhu saṅgham etat avoca
translated: Then Venerable Assagutta said to the Sangha of monks,

original: “atthāvuso tāvatiṁsabhavane vejayantassa pācīnato ketumatī nāma vimānaṁ, tattha mahāseno
analyzed: attha āvuso tāvatisa bhavane vejayantassa pācīnatas ketumatī nāma vimāna tattha mahā senaḥ
translated: “Friends, to the east of the Vejayanta Palace in the Tāvatiṁsa heaven there is a divine palace named Ketumatī. There the great general

original: nāma devaputto paṭivasati, so paṭibalo tena milindena raññā saddhiṁ sallapituṁ kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinetun”ti.
analyzed: nāma deva putto paṭivasati so paṭibalaḥ tena milindena raññā saddhim sallapitum kaṅkham paṭivinetum
translated: the god named Nāma lives there. He is able to converse with King Milinda and resolve his doubts.”

original: Atha kho koṭisatā arahanto yugandharapabbate antarahitā tāvatiṁsabhavane pāturahesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho koṭi satāḥ arahantaḥ yugandhara pabbate tāvati sa bhavane pāturahesu
translated: Then the 500 arahants disappeared from Mount Yugandhara and reappeared in the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: Addasā kho sakko devānamindo te bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante, disvāna yenāyasmā assagutto
analyzed: addasā kho sakkaḥ devānamindo te bhikkhū dūratas vas āgacchante disvāna yena ayasmai assagutto
translated: Sakka saw the monks coming from afar. He approached the venerable Assagutta,

original: tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ assaguttaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi,
analyzed: tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam assaguttam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi
translated: bowed down, and stood to one side.

original: ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho sakko devānamindo āyasmantaṁ assaguttaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ āyasmantam assaguttam etat avoca
translated: He said to him,

original: “mahā kho, bhante, bhikkhusaṅgho anuppatto, ahaṁ saṅghassa ārāmiko, kenattho, kiṁ mayā karaṇīyan”ti?
analyzed: mahā kho bhante bhikkhu saṅghaḥ an uppattaḥ aham saṅghassa ārāmikaḥ kenatthaḥ kim mayā karaṇīyanti
translated: “Venerable sir, a great sangha of monks has arrived. I am the attendant of the Sangha. What is needed? What should I do?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā assagutto sakkaṁ devānamindaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasman assaguttaḥ sakkam devānamindam etat avoca
translated: The venerable Assagutta said to Sakka,

original: “ayaṁ kho, mahārāja, jambudīpe sāgalanagare milindo nāma rājā vitaṇḍavādī durāsado
analyzed: ayam khalu mahā rāja jambudīpe sāgala nagare milindaḥ nāma rājā vitaṇḍa vādī durāsadaḥ
translated: “Great king, in the city of Sāgala in the Rose-Apple Island, there is a king named Milinda who is argumentative and hard to subdue.

original: duppasaho puthutitthakarānaṁ aggamakkhāyati, so bhikkhusaṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā diṭṭhivādena
analyzed: duppasahaḥ puthu titthakarānam aggam akkhāyati saḥ bhikkhu saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā diṭṭhi vādena
translated: who is difficult to defeat and is considered the best of the various sectarians, has approached the Sangha of monks and asked them questions with a view to a dispute,

original: pañhaṁ pucchitvā bhikkhusaṅghaṁ viheṭhetī”ti.
analyzed: pañham pucchitvā bhikkhu saṅgham viheṭheti iti
translated: and is harassing the Sangha of monks.”

original: Atha kho sakko devānamindo āyasmantaṁ assaguttaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ āyasmantam assaguttam etat avoca
translated: Then Sakka, the lord of the gods, said to Ven. Assagutta,

original: “ayaṁ kho, bhante, milindo rājā ito cuto manussesu uppanno, eso kho, bhante, ketumativimāne
analyzed: ayam kho bhante milindaḥ rājā itas cutaḥ manussesu uppannaḥ esaḥ kho bhante ketumati vimāne
translated: “Sir, this King Milinda, having passed away from here, has reappeared among humans. Sir, in the Ketumatī mansion

original: mahāseno nāma devaputto paṭivasati, so paṭibalo tena milindena raññā saddhiṁ sallapituṁ
analyzed: mahāsenaḥ nāma deva putto paṭivasati so paṭibalaḥ tena milindena raññā saddhim sallapitu
translated: there is a god named Mahāsena. He is able to converse with King Milinda

original: kaṅkhaṁ paṭivinetuṁ, taṁ devaputtaṁ yācissāma manussalokūpapattiyā”ti.
analyzed: kaṅkham paṭivinetu tam deva puttam yācissāma manussa loka upapattiyā ati
translated: and to resolve his doubts. Let’s request that god to reappear in the human world.”

original: Atha kho sakko devānamindo bhikkhusaṅghaṁ purakkhatvā ketumativimānaṁ pavisitvā mahāsenaṁ devaputtaṁ āliṅgitvā etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ bhikkhu saṅgham purakkhatvā ketumati vimānam pavisitvā mahāsenam deva puttam āliṅgitvā etat avoca
translated: Then Sakka, the lord of the gods, having entered the Ketumatī mansion with the Sangha of monks in front of him, embraced the god Mahāsena and said to him,

original: “yācati taṁ, mārisa, bhikkhusaṅgho manussalokūpapattiyā”ti.
analyzed: yācati ta mārisa bhikkhu saṅghaḥ manussa loka upapattiyā ati
translated: “Sir, the Sangha of monks requests that you reappear in the human world.”

original: “Na me, bhante, manussalokenattho kammabahulena, tibbo manussaloko, idhevāhaṁ, bhante, devaloke uparūparūpapattiko hutvā parinibbāyissāmī”ti.🔽Dutiyampi …
analyzed: na me bhante manussa lokena atthaḥ kamma bahulena tibbaḥ manussa lokaḥ idha eva āha bhante deva loke uparūparūpapattikaḥ hutvā parinibbāyissāmi iti  dutiyam pi
translated: “I have no interest in the human world, with its many activities. The human world is a terrible place. Right here in the divine world, I will be reborn in a higher and higher state and then attain final Nibbāna.”🔽A second and a third time Sakka made the same request,

original: tatiyampi kho sakkena devānamindena yācito mahāseno devaputto evamāha—🔽“na me, bhante, manussalokenattho kammabahulena, tibbo manussaloko, idhevāhaṁ, bhante, devaloke uparūparūpapattiko hutvā parinibbāyissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho sakkena devānamindena yācitaḥ mahāsenaḥ deva puttaḥ evam āha  na me bhante manussa lokena atthaḥ kamma bahulena tibbaḥ manussa lokaḥ idha eva āha bhante deva loke uparūparūpapattikaḥ hutvā parinibbāyissāmi iti
translated: and a second and a third time Mahāseno replied as before.

original: Atha kho āyasmā assagutto mahāsenaṁ devaputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai assaguttaḥ mahāsenam deva puttam etat avoca
translated: Then Venerable Assagutta said to Mahāseno,

original: “idha mayaṁ, mārisa, sadevakaṁ lokaṁ anuvilokayamānā aññatra tayā milindassa rañño
analyzed: idha maya mārisa sa devakam lokam anuvilokayamānā aññatra tayā milindassa rañño
translated: “Sir, as we survey the world with its gods, we don’t see anyone else but you who can defeat King Milinda in debate

original: vādaṁ bhinditvā sāsanaṁ paggahetuṁ samatthaṁ aññaṁ kañci na passāma, yācati taṁ,
analyzed: vādam bhinditvā sāsanam paggahetum samattham aññam kañci na passāma yācati ta
translated: and take up the Buddha’s cause. The Sangha of monks requests you,

original: mārisa, bhikkhusaṅgho, sādhu, sappurisa, manussaloke nibbattitvā dasabalassa sāsanaṁ paggaṇhāhī”ti.
analyzed: mārisa bhikkhu saṅghaḥ sādhu sappurisa manussa loke nibbattitvā dasabalassa sāsanam paggaṇhāhi iti
translated: please be reborn in the human world and take up the Buddha’s cause.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, mahāseno devaputto “ahaṁ kira milindassa rañño vādaṁ bhinditvā buddhasāsanaṁ
analyzed: evam vutte mahāsenaḥ deva putto aham kira milindassa raññaḥ vādam bhinditvā buddha sāsana
translated: When this was said, the god Mahāsenā thought, “I will be able to break King Milinda’s case and uphold the Buddha’s Teaching.”

original: paggahetuṁ samattho bhavissāmī”ti haṭṭhapahaṭṭho udaggudaggo hutvā “sādhu, bhante,
analyzed: paggahetum samatthaḥ bhavissāmi iti haṭṭha pahaṭṭhaḥ udagga udaggaḥ hutvā sādhu bhante
translated: Delighted and exultant, he said, “Venerable Sir,

original: manussaloke uppajjissāmī”ti paṭiññaṁ adāsi.
analyzed: manussa loke uppajjissāmi iti paṭiññam adāsi
translated: I will be reborn in the human world.”

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū devaloke taṁ karaṇīyaṁ tīretvā devesu tāvatiṁsesu antarahitā himavante pabbate rakkhitatale pāturahesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū deva loke tam karaṇīyam tīretvā devesu tāvatisesu antarahitāḥ himavante pabbate rakkhita tale pāturahesu
translated: Then, after completing their business in the god realm, the monks disappeared from the Tāvatiṁsa heaven and reappeared in the Himalayas in the Rakkhita Cave.

original: Atha kho āyasmā assagutto bhikkhusaṅghaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai assaguttaḥ bhikkhu saṅgham etat avoca
translated: The Venerable Assagutta then said to the Sangha of monks,

original: “atthāvuso, imasmiṁ bhikkhusaṅghe koci bhikkhu sannipātaṁ anāgato”ti.
analyzed: attha āvuso imasmin bhikkhu saṅghe koci bhikkhu sannipātam anāgataḥ ti
translated: “Is there any monk who has not come to this gathering?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu āyasmantaṁ assaguttaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: evam vutte aññataraḥ bhikkhu āyasmantam assaguttam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, a certain monk said to the Venerable Assagutta,

original: “atthi, bhante, āyasmā rohaṇo ito sattame divase himavantaṁ pabbataṁ pavisitvā nirodhaṁ samāpanno, tassa santike dūtaṁ pāhethā”ti.
analyzed: atthi bhante āyasmā rohaṇaḥ itas sattame divase himavantam pabbatam pavisitvā nirodham samāpanno tassa santike dūtam pāhetha ati
translated: “Venerable sir, there is the Venerable Rohaṇa. Seven days ago he entered the Himalayas and attained cessation. Send a messenger to him.”

original: Āyasmāpi rohaṇo taṅkhaṇaññeva nirodhā vuṭṭhāya “saṅgho maṁ paṭimānetī”ti himavante pabbate antarahito rakkhitatale koṭisatānaṁ arahantānaṁ purato pāturahosi.
analyzed: āyasmā api rohaṇo nirodhā vuṭṭhāya saṅghaḥ mam paṭimāneti iti himavante pabbate antarahitaḥ rakkhita tale koṭi satānam arahantānam puratas pāturahosi
translated: The venerable Rohaṇa, emerging from cessation at that very moment, thought, “The Sangha is summoning me.” He disappeared from the Himālaya mountains and reappeared in front of the hundred thousand arahats on the Protected Floor.

original: Atha kho āyasmā assagutto āyasmantaṁ rohaṇaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā assaguttaḥ āyasmantam rohaṇam etat avoca
translated: Then the venerable Assagutta said to the venerable Rohaṇa,

original: “kiṁ nu kho, āvuso, rohaṇa buddhasāsane bhijjante na passasi saṅghassa karaṇīyānī”ti.
analyzed: kim nu kho āvuso rohaṇa buddha sāsane bhijjante na passasi saṅghassa karaṇīyāni iti
translated: “Friend Rohaṇa, do you not see that the Buddha’s Dispensation is breaking up and that the Sangha has work to do?”

original: “Amanasikāro me, bhante, ahosī”ti.
analyzed: amanasikāraḥ me bhante ahosi iti
translated: “I was inattentive, venerable sir.”

original: “Tena hāvuso rohaṇa, daṇḍakammaṁ karohī”ti.
analyzed: tena ha āvuso rohaṇa daṇḍa kammam karohi iti
translated: “Well then, friend Rohaṇa, you must do a deed of punishment.”

original: “Kiṁ, bhante, karomī”ti?
analyzed: ki bhante karomi iti
translated: “What shall I do, venerable sir?”

original: “Atthāvuso rohaṇa, himavantapabbatapasse gajaṅgalaṁ nāma brāhmaṇagāmo, tattha soṇuttaro
analyzed: attha āvuso rohaṇa himavanta pabbata passe gajaṅgalam nāma brāhmaṇa gāmo tattha
translated: “There is, friend Rohaṇa, a brahmin village called Gajaṅgala on the slopes of the Himālaya mountains. A brahmin called Soṇuttara

original: nāma brāhmaṇo paṭivasati, tassa putto uppajjissati nāgaseno nāma dārako, tena hi
analyzed: nāma brāhmaṇaḥ paṭivasati tassa putto uppajjissati nāgasenaḥ nāma dārako tena hi
translated: lives there. A son will be born to him called Nāgasena. Therefore,

original: tvaṁ, āvuso rohaṇa, dasamāsādhikāni satta vassāni taṁ kulaṁ piṇḍāya pavisitvā nāgasenaṁ
analyzed: tvam āvuso rohaṇa dasa māsa adhikāni satta vassāni tam kulam piṇḍāya pavisitvā nāgasena
translated: friend Rohaṇa, you must enter that family for alms for seven years and seven days and bring up the child Nāgasena

original: dārakaṁ nīharitvā pabbājehi, pabbajiteva tasmiṁ daṇḍakammato muccissasī”ti.
analyzed: dārakam nīharitvā pabbājehi pabbajitā iva tasmin daṇḍa kammataḥ muccissasi iti
translated: and have him go forth. When he has gone forth, you will be released from the punishment.”🔽“Very well,”

original: Āyasmāpi kho rohaṇo “sādhū”ti—🔽sampaṭicchi.
analyzed: sādhu iti  sampaṭicchi
translated: agreed Venerable Rohaṇa.

original: Mahāsenopi kho devaputto devalokā cavitvā soṇuttarabrāhmaṇassa bhariyāya kucchismiṁ
analyzed: mahāsenaḥ api kho devaputtaḥ deva lokā cavitvā soṇuttara brāhmaṇassa bhariyāya kucchismi
translated: And Mahāsenā, after passing away from the god realm,

original: paṭisandhiṁ aggahesi, saha paṭisandhiggahaṇā tayo acchariyā abbhutā dhammā pāturahesuṁ,
analyzed: paṭisandhim aggahesi saha paṭisandhi ggahaṇā tayaḥ acchariyāḥ abbhutāḥ dhammāḥ pāturahesu
translated: reentered her womb. As soon as she conceived, three amazing and wonderful things became apparent:

original: āvudhabhaṇḍāni pajjaliṁsu, aggasassaṁ abhinipphannaṁ, mahāmegho abhippavassi.🔽Āyasmāpi kho rohaṇo tassa paṭisandhiggahaṇato paṭṭhāya dasamāsādhikāni satta vassāni🔽taṁ kulaṁ piṇḍāya pavisanto ekadivasampi kaṭacchumattaṁ bhattaṁ vā uḷuṅkamattaṁ yāguṁ
analyzed: āvudha bhaṇḍāni mahā meghaḥ abhippavassi  āyasmā api kho rohaṇaḥ tassa paṭisandhi ggahaṇato paṭṭhāya dasa māsa adhikāni satta vassāni  tam kulam piṇḍāya pavisantaḥ eka divasam pi kaṭacchu mattam bhattam vā uḷuṅka mattam yāgu
translated: the weapons in the arsenal glowed, the first rice ripened, and a great rain cloud rained down.🔽From the time of her conception, Venerable Rohaṇa🔽did not receive so much as a ladleful of boiled rice or a spoonful of broth, or so much as a greeting, reverential salutation, or polite address, when entering that family for alms, for seven years and seven months.

original: vā abhivādanaṁ vā añjalikammaṁ vā sāmīcikammaṁ vā nālattha, atha kho akkosaññeva
analyzed: vā abhivādanam vā añjali kammam vā sāmīci kammam vā na alattha atha kho akkosaññā iva
translated: Instead, he was scolded.

original: paribhāsaññeva paṭilabhati “aticchatha, bhante”ti vacanamattampi vattā nāma nāhosi,
analyzed: paribhāsaññā iva paṭilabhati aticchatha bhante iti vacana mattam pi vattā nāma na ahosi
translated: and he only got the impression that they were being polite. He did not even get the words “You may go” uttered.

original: dasamāsādhikānaṁ pana sattannaṁ vassānaṁ accayena ekadivasaṁ “aticchatha, bhante”ti🔽vacanamattaṁ alattha.
analyzed: dasa māsa adhikānam pana vassānam accayena eka divasam aticchatha bhante iti  vacana mattam alattha
translated: But after seven years and ten months, he got the words “You may go” uttered on one day.

original: Taṁ divasameva brāhmaṇopi bahi kammantā āgacchanto paṭipathe theraṁ disvā “kiṁ, bho pabbajita, amhākaṁ gehaṁ agamitthā”ti—āha.

translated: On that very day, the brahmin, who had been away on business, saw the elder on his way back and said to him, “Did you come to our house, recluse?”

translated: When the brahmin saw him, he said,

translated: “Brahmin, for seven years and more we have been saying to you, ‘Give us leave to go.’🔽Yesterday we received your permission to go. We said what we did

analyzed: ime vācā paṭisandhāra mattam pi labhitvā jana majjhe labhimha ati pasasanti  kiñci khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam vā labhitvā kasmai na pasasanti iti pasīditvā attanaḥ

analyzed: atthāya paṭiyādita bhattataḥ tad upiyam ca byañjanam dāpetvā  bhikkham sabbakālam tumhe labhissatha ati

translated: He taught him all this by heart, and he also taught him the knowledge of the great humans and the knowledge of the world.

translated: Nāgasena then said to his father,

original: Athassa mātāpitaro “pabbajitvāpi no putto mantaṁ gaṇhatu, gahetvā puna āgacchissatī”ti maññamānā “gaṇha, puttā”ti anujāniṁsu.
analyzed: athassa mātā pitaro pabbajitvā api no puttaḥ mantam gaṇhatu gahetvā punar āgacchissati iti maññamānāḥ gaṇha putta ati
translated: Thinking, “Even if our son goes forth, he’ll learn the chant and then return,” his parents gave their permission.

original: Atha kho āyasmā rohaṇo nāgasenaṁ dārakaṁ ādāya yena vattaniyaṁ senāsanaṁ, yena vijambhavatthu
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā rohaṇaḥ nāgasenam dārakam ādāya yena vattaniyam senāsana yena vijambha vatthu
translated: Then Venerable Rohaṇa took the boy Nāgasena to the dwelling place at Vattaniya, to the place called Vijambha.

original: tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā vijambhavatthusmiṁ senāsane ekarattaṁ vasitvā yena rakkhitatalaṁ🔽tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā koṭisatānaṁ arahantānaṁ majjhe nāgasenaṁ dārakaṁ pabbājesi.
analyzed: tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā vijambhavatthusmim senāsane eka rattam vasitvā yena  tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā koṭi satānam arahantānam majjhe nāgasenam dārakam pabbājesi
translated: After staying there for one night, he went to Rakkhita Island.🔽In the midst of a hundred thousand perfected beings, he gave the going forth to the boy Nāgasena.

original: Pabbajito ca panāyasmā nāgaseno āyasmantaṁ rohaṇaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: pabbajitaḥ ca pana āyasmā nāgasenaḥ āyasmantam rohaṇam etat avoca
translated: After going forth, Venerable Nāgasena said to Venerable Rohaṇa,

original: “gahito me, bhante, tava veso, detha me dāni mantan”ti.
analyzed: gahitaḥ me bhante tava vesaḥ me dāni mantanti
translated: “I’ve taken on your appearance, Sir. Now give me the recitation.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā rohaṇo “kimhi nu khohaṁ nāgasenaṁ vineyyaṁ paṭhamaṁ vinaye vā suttante vā abhidhamme vā”ti—🔽cintetvā “paṇḍito kho ayaṁ nāgaseno, sakkoti sukheneva abhidhammaṁ pariyāpuṇitun”ti paṭhamaṁ abhidhamme vinesi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā rohaṇaḥ kimhi nu kha uham nāgasenam vineyyam paṭhamam vinaye vā suttante vā abhidhamme vā ati  cintetvā paṇḍitaḥ kho ayam nāgasenaḥ sakkoti sukhena iva abhidhammam pariyāpuṇitun ti paṭhamam abhidhamme vinesi
translated: Then Venerable Rohaṇa thought, “In what should I train Nāgasena first: in the Monastic Law, in the discourses, or in the advanced teachings?”🔽And he thought, “Nāgasena is wise. He’s able to easily learn the advanced teachings.” He therefore trained him first in the advanced teachings.

original: Āyasmā ca nāgaseno “kusalā dhammā, akusalā dhammā, abyākatā dhammā”ti tikadukapaṭimaṇḍitaṁ🔽dhammasaṅgaṇīpakaraṇaṁ, khandhavibhaṅgādiaṭṭhārasa vibhaṅgapaṭimaṇḍitaṁ vibhaṅgappakaraṇaṁ,🔽“saṅgaho asaṅgaho”ti ādinā cuddasavidhena vibhattaṁ dhātukathāpakaraṇaṁ, “khandhapaññatti
analyzed: āyasmā ca nāgaseno kusalāḥ dhammāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ abyākatāḥ dhammā ti  dhamma saṅgaṇī pakaraṇa vibhaṅga paṭimaṇḍitam vibhaṅga ppakaraṇa  saṅgahaḥ asaṅgahaḥ ti ādinā cuddasavidhena vibhattam dhātu kathā apakaraṇa khandha paññatti
translated: Venerable Nāgasena learned the Dhamma-sangaṇī, which is adorned with the three-part method,🔽the Vibhanga, which is adorned with the eighteen chapters beginning with the analysis of the aggregates,🔽the Dhatu-kathā, which is divided into fourteen sections beginning with “encompassing” and “not encompassing”,

original: āyatanapaññattī”ti ādinā chabbidhena vibhattaṁ puggalapaññattippakaraṇaṁ, sakavāde
analyzed: āyatana paññatti iti ādinā chabbidhena vibhattam saka vāde
translated: the Puggala-paññatti, which is divided into six sections beginning with “the designation of the aggregates” and “the designation of the sense-spheres”,🔽and the seven books of the Abhidhamma beginning with the Dhammasangani.

original: pañcasuttasatāni paravāde pañcasuttasatānīti suttasahassaṁ samodhānetvā vibhattaṁ
analyzed: pañca sutta satāni paravāde pañca sutta satāni iti sutta sahassam samodhānetvā
translated: and the five hundred suttas of the opponents. Having combined the thousand suttas, he divided them up

original: kathāvatthuppakaraṇaṁ, “mūlayamakaṁ khandhayamakan”ti ādinā dasavidhena vibhattaṁ
analyzed: mūlayamakam khandhayamakan ti ādinā dasavidhena
translated: into the Kathāvatthu, and he divided it up into ten sections beginning with “The root couplet” and “The couplet of the aggregates.”

original: yamakappakaraṇaṁ, “hetupaccayo ārammaṇapaccayo”ti ādinā catuvīsatividhena vibhattaṁ
analyzed: hetu paccayo ārammaṇa paccayo ti ādinā catuvīsatividhena
translated: He divided up the Yamaka into twenty-four sections beginning with “Cause condition, object condition.”

original: paṭṭhānappakaraṇanti sabbaṁ taṁ abhidhammapiṭakaṁ ekeneva sajjhāyena paguṇaṁ katvā
analyzed: paṭṭhāna ppakaraṇan ti sabbam tat abhidhamma piṭakam ekena iva sajjhāyena paguṇam katvā
translated: He divided up the Paṭṭhāna into the following sections: “Root, faculty, jhāna, path, fruit, nibbāna, condition, object, association, dissociation, presence, absence, disappearance, non-disappearance.” Having made all that Abhidhamma Piṭaka familiar to himself by a single recitation,

original: “tiṭṭhatha, bhante, na puna osāretha, ettakenevāhaṁ sajjhāyissāmī”ti—āha.
analyzed: tiṭṭhatha bhante na puna osāretha ettakena iva aham sajjhāyissāmi iti āha
translated: he said, “Wait, venerable sirs, do not recite it again. I shall recite it by myself.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā nāgaseno yena koṭisatā arahanto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā koṭisate arahante etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā nāgasenaḥ yena koṭi satāḥ arahantaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā koṭi sate arahante etat avoca
translated: Then the venerable Nāgasena approached the hundred thousand arahats and said to them,

original: “ahaṁ kho, bhante, ‘kusalā dhammā, akusalā dhammā, abyākatā dhammā’ti imesu tīsu padesu pakkhipitvā sabbaṁ taṁ abhidhammapiṭakaṁ vitthārena osāressāmī”ti.
analyzed: aham kho bhante kusalāḥ dhammāḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ abyākatāḥ dhammā ti imesu tīsu padesu pakkhipitvā sabbam tam abhidhammapiṭakam vitthārena osāressāmi iti
translated: “Venerable sirs, having included the wholesome states, the unwholesome states, and the indeterminate states in these three sections, I shall recite the whole of that Abhidhamma Piṭaka in detail.”

original: “Sādhu, nāgasena, osārehī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu nāgasena osārehi iti
translated: “Very well, Nāgasena, recite it.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā nāgaseno satta māsāni satta pakaraṇāni vitthārena osāresi, pathavī🔽unnadi, devatā sādhukāramadaṁsu, brahmāno apphoṭesuṁ, dibbāni candanacuṇṇāni dibbāni
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā nāgasenaḥ satta māsāni satta pakaraṇāni vitthārena osāresi pathavī  unnadi devatā sādhukāra madasu brahmānaḥ apphoṭesu dibbāni candana cuṇṇāni dibbāni
translated: Then the venerable Nāgasena expounded the seven books at length during seven months,

original: ca mandāravapupphāni abhippavassiṁsu.
analyzed: ca mandārava pupphāni abhippavassisu
translated: the earth resounded, the devas applauded, the Brahmas clapped their hands, and celestial sandal-wood powder and celestial mandārava flowers rained down.

original: Atha kho koṭisatā arahanto āyasmantaṁ nāgasenaṁ paripuṇṇavīsativassaṁ rakkhitatale upasampādesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho koṭi satāḥ arahantaḥ āyasmantam nāgasenam paripuṇṇa vīsati vassam rakkhita tale upasampādesu
translated: Then the thousand arahats gave the higher ordination to the venerable Nāgasena when he was twenty years old in the Rakkhita Grove.

original: Upasampanno ca panāyasmā nāgaseno tassā rattiyā accayena pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā
analyzed: upasampannaḥ ca pana āyasmā nāgasenaḥ tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā
translated: And when the night was past the venerable Nāgasena dressed in the morning time,

original: pattacīvaramādāya upajjhāyena saddhiṁ gāmaṁ piṇḍāya pavisanto evarūpaṁ parivitakkaṁ
analyzed: patta cīvaram ādāya upajjhāyena saddhim gāmam piṇḍāya pavisantaḥ evarūpam
translated: took his bowl and outer robe, and entered the village for alms together with his preceptor. As he was going along he had this thought:

original: uppādesi “tuccho vata me upajjhāyo, bālo vata me upajjhāyo, ṭhapetvā avasesaṁ buddhavacanaṁ🔽paṭhamaṁ maṁ abhidhamme vinesī”ti.
analyzed: uppādesi tucchaḥ vata me upajjhāyaḥ bālaḥ vata me upajjhāyaḥ ṭhapetvā avasesam buddha vacana 🔽paṭhamam mama abhidhamme vinesi iti
translated: “My preceptor is empty, my preceptor is foolish, for he taught me the Abhidhamma first and left the rest of the Buddha’s word for later.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā rohaṇo āyasmato nāgasenassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya āyasmantaṁ nāgasenaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā rohaṇaḥ āyasmataḥ nāgasenassa cetasā cetaḥ upari vitakka maññāya āyasmantam nāgasenam etat avoca
translated: Then the venerable Rohaṇa, knowing with his mind the course of thought in the mind of the venerable Nāgasena, said this to the venerable Nāgasena:

original: “ananucchavikaṁ kho nāgasena parivitakkaṁ vitakkesi, na kho panetaṁ nāgasena tavānucchavikan”ti.
analyzed: an anucchavikam kho nāgasena parivitakkam vitakkesi na kho pana etam nāgasena tava anucchavikam ti
translated: “It is not fitting, Nāgasena, that you should think such a thought. This is not proper for you, Nāgasena.”

original: Atha kho āyasmato nāgasenassa etadahosi—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmataḥ nāgasenassa etat ahosi
translated: Then this occurred to the venerable Nāgasena:

original: “acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, yatra hi nāma me upajjhāyo cetasā cetoparivitakkaṁ jānissati, paṇḍito vata me upajjhāyo, yannūnāhaṁ upajjhāyaṁ khamāpeyyan”ti.
analyzed: acchariyam vata bho abbhutam vata bho yatra hi nāma me upajjhāyaḥ cetasā cetaḥ upari vitakkam jānissati paṇḍitaḥ vata me upajjhāyaḥ yat nūna aham upajjhāyam khamāpeyyanti
translated: “It is wonderful, indeed, it is marvellous, that my preceptor will know the course of thought in my mind. My preceptor is indeed wise. Now, let me ask pardon of my preceptor.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā nāgaseno āyasmantaṁ rohaṇaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā nāgasenaḥ āyasmantam rohaṇam etat avoca
translated: Then the venerable Nāgasena said this to the venerable Rohaṇa:

original: “khamatha me, bhante, na puna evarūpaṁ vitakkessāmī”ti.
analyzed: khamatha me bhante na punar evarūpam vitakkessāmi iti
translated: “Pardon me, reverend Sir, I will not think such a thought again.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā rohaṇo āyasmantaṁ nāgasenaṁ etadavoca “na kho tyāhaṁ nāgasena ettāvatā
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmā rohaṇaḥ āyasmantam nāgasenam etat avoca na khalu tya aham nāgasenaḥ ettāvatā
translated: Then the venerable Rohaṇa said this to the venerable Nāgasena: “I do not pardon you, Nāgasena, so long as

original: khamāmi, atthi kho nāgasena sāgalaṁ nāma nagaraṁ, tattha milindo nāma rājā rajjaṁ
analyzed: khamāmi atthi kho nāgasena sāgalam nāma nagara tattha milindaḥ nāma rājā
translated: you do not tell me the reason for your thought. There is, Nāgasena, a city named Sāgala, there a king named Milinda rules🔽his realm.

original: kāreti, so diṭṭhivādena pañhaṁ pucchitvā bhikkhusaṅghaṁ viheṭheti, sace tvaṁ tattha
analyzed: kāreti saḥ diṭṭhi vādena pañham pucchitvā bhikkhu saṅgham viheṭheti sace tvam tattha
translated: and he is harassing the Community of monks with questions on his views. If you go there

original: gantvā taṁ rājānaṁ dametvā buddhasāsane pasādessasi, evāhaṁ taṁ khamissāmī”ti.
analyzed: gantvā tam rājānam dametvā buddha sāsane pasādessasi eva aham tam khamissāmi iti
translated: and tame that king and win him over to the Buddha’s Dispensation, then I will forgive you.”

original: “Tiṭṭhatu, bhante, eko milindo rājā;
analyzed: tiṭṭhatu bhante ekaḥ milindaḥ rājā
translated: “Let alone one king, reverend Sir,

original: sace, bhante, sakalajambudīpe sabbe rājāno āgantvā maṁ pañhaṁ puccheyyuṁ, sabbaṁ
analyzed: sace bhante sakala jambudīpe sabbe rājānaḥ āgantvā mama pañham puccheyyu
translated: if all the kings in the world were to come and ask me a question, I would

original: taṁ visajjetvā sampadālessāmi, ‘khamatha me, bhante’ti vatvā, ‘na khamāmī’ti vutte
analyzed: tam visajjetvā sampadālessāmi khamatha me bhante iti vatvā na khamāmi iti vutte
translated: answer them all, and after saying ‘Forgive me, reverend Sir,’ if he says ‘I do not forgive you,’

original: tena hi, bhante, imaṁ temāsaṁ kassa santike vasissāmī”ti—āha.
analyzed: tena hi bhante imam temāsam kassa santike vasissāmi iti āha
translated: then, reverend Sir, for how long will I live with him?”

original: “Ayaṁ kho, nāgasena, āyasmā assagutto vattaniye senāsane viharati, gaccha tvaṁ, nāgasena,🔽yenāyasmā assagutto tenupasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmato assaguttassa
analyzed: ayam kho nāgasenaḥ āyasmai assagutto vattaniye senāsane viharati gaccha tva nāgasena  yena ayasmā assagutto tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmataḥ assaguttassa
translated: “Nāgasena, this venerable Assagutta is living in a suitable dwelling place, go, Nāgasena,🔽and after approaching him, and worshipping the venerable Assagutta with your head at his feet,

original: pāde sirasā vanda, evañca naṁ vadehi ‘upajjhāyo me, bhante, tumhākaṁ pāde sirasā
analyzed: pāde sirasā vanda evam ca nam vadehi upajjhāyaḥ me bhante tumhākam pāde sirasā
translated: say this to him ‘Reverend Sir, my preceptor worships with his head at your feet,

original: vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati, upajjhāyo
analyzed: vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati upajjhāyo
translated: and asks about your health, strength, comfort, and freedom from illness, and says that your preceptor

original: me, bhante, imaṁ temāsaṁ tumhākaṁ santike vasituṁ maṁ pahiṇī’ti, ‘konāmo te upajjhāyo’ti
analyzed: me bhante imam temāsam tumhākam santike vasitum mam pahiṇi iti konāmaḥ te upajjhāyaḥ ti
translated: has sent me to live with you for these three months.’ If he asks, ‘What is the name of your preceptor?’

original: ca vutte ‘rohaṇatthero nāma, bhante’ti vadeyyāsi, ‘ahaṁ konāmo’ti vutte evaṁ vadeyyāsi
analyzed: ca vutte rohaṇattheraḥ nāma bhante iti vadeyyāsi aham konāmaḥ ti vutte evam vadeyyāsi
translated: you should say, ‘My preceptor’s name is Rohaṇa.’ If he asks, ‘What is your name?’ you should say,

original: ‘mama upajjhāyo, bhante, tumhākaṁ nāmaṁ jānātī’”ti.
analyzed: mama upajjhāyaḥ bhante tumhākam nāmam jānāti iti
translated: ‘My preceptor knows your name.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā nāgaseno āyasmantaṁ rohaṇaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā🔽pattacīvaramādāya anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena vattaniyaṁ senāsanaṁ, yenāyasmā
analyzed: eva bhanta iti kho āyasmā nāgasenaḥ āyasmantam rohaṇam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā  patta cīvaram ādāya anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena vattaniyam senāsana yena ayasmā
translated: “Yes, Sir,” replied Nāgasena. He bowed down to Rohaṇa, circumambulated him with his right side toward him,

original: assagutto tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ assaguttaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ
analyzed: assaguttaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam assaguttam abhivādetvā ekamanta
translated: and taking his bowl and robe, he set out wandering. Eventually he came to the dwelling place at Vattaniya, where he approached

original: aṭṭhāsi, ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho āyasmā nāgaseno āyasmantaṁ assaguttaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho āyasmā nāgasenaḥ āyasmantam assaguttam etat avoca
translated: the venerable Assagutta, bowed, and stood to one side. The venerable Nāgasena said to him:

original: “upajjhāyo me, bhante, tumhākaṁ pāde sirasā vandati, evañca vadeti appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ🔽lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati, upajjhāyo me, bhante, imaṁ temāsaṁ tumhākaṁ
analyzed: upajjhāyaḥ me bhante tumhākam pāde sirasā vandati evam ca vadeti appa ābādham appa ātaṅka  lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati upajjhāyaḥ me bhante imam temāsam
translated: “Venerable Sir, my preceptor pays respect with his head at your feet and says that he hopes you are well and free from sickness,

original: santike vasituṁ maṁ pahiṇī”ti.
analyzed: santike vasitum mama pahiṇi iti
translated: that he hopes you are comfortable and strong, and that he sends me to live with you for these three months.”

original: Atha kho āyasmā assagutto āyasmantaṁ nāgasenaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai assaguttaḥ āyasmantam nāgasenam etat avoca
translated: Then the Venerable Assagutta said this to the Venerable Nagasena:

original: “tvaṁ kiṁnāmosī”ti.
analyzed: tvam kināmā asi iti
translated: “What is your name?”

original: “Ahaṁ, bhante, nāgaseno nāmā”ti.
analyzed: aha bhante nāgasenaḥ nāma ati
translated: “Venerable Sir, my name is Nagasena.”

original: “Konāmo te upajjhāyo”ti?
analyzed: konāmo te upajjhāyaḥ ti
translated: “What is the name of your preceptor?”

original: “Upajjhāyo me, bhante, rohaṇo nāmā”ti.
analyzed: upajjhāyaḥ me bhante rohaṇaḥ nāma ati
translated: “Venerable Sir, my preceptor’s name is Rohana.”

original: “Ahaṁ konāmo”ti.
analyzed: aham konāmā uti
translated: “What is my name?”

original: “Upajjhāyo me, bhante, tumhākaṁ nāmaṁ jānātī”ti.
analyzed: upajjhāyaḥ me bhante tumhākam nāmam jānāti iti
translated: “Venerable Sir, my preceptor knows your name.”

original: “Sādhu, nāgasena, pattacīvaraṁ paṭisāmehī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu nāgasena patta cīvaram paṭisāmehi iti
translated: “Very well, Nagasena, put away your bowl and robe.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante”ti pattacīvaraṁ paṭisāmetvā punadivase pariveṇaṁ sammajjitvā mukhodakaṁ dantapoṇaṁ upaṭṭhapesi.
analyzed: sādhu bhante iti patta cīvaram paṭisāmetvā puna divase pariveṇam sammajjitvā mukha udakam danta poṇam upaṭṭhapesi
translated: “Very well, Venerable Sir,” and after putting away his bowl and robe, he swept out the yard the next day and prepared mouth-washing water and tooth sticks.

original: Thero sammajjitaṭṭhānaṁ paṭisammajji, taṁ udakaṁ chaḍḍetvā aññaṁ udakaṁ āhari, tañca
analyzed: theraḥ sammajjita ṭṭhānam paṭisammajji tam udakam chaḍḍetvā aññam udakam āhari tat ca
translated: The Elder swept out the place that had been swept and threw away the water that was already there and brought other water, and he threw away the tooth stick that was already there and brought another one.

original: dantakaṭṭhaṁ apanetvā aññaṁ dantakaṭṭhaṁ gaṇhi, na ālāpasallāpaṁ akāsi, evaṁ satta
analyzed: danta kaṭṭham apanetvā aññam danta kaṭṭham gaṇhi na ālāpa sallāpam akāsi evam satta
translated: He took out the tooth cleaner and put in a new one, but he didn’t say anything. And he did the same thing on the following days.

original: divasāni katvā sattame divase puna pucchitvā puna tena tatheva vutte vassavāsaṁ anujāni.
analyzed: divasāni katvā sattame divase puna pucchitvā puna tena tathā iva vutte vassa vāsam anujāni
translated: After seven days, he asked again. And when he got the same answer, he gave his permission to stay for the rainy season.

original: Tena kho pana samayena ekā mahāupāsikā āyasmantaṁ assaguttaṁ tiṁsamattāni vassāni upaṭṭhāsi.

original: Atha kho āyasmā nāgaseno dūtassa vacanaṁ sutvā asokārāme antarahito himavante pabbate rakkhitatale koṭisatānaṁ arahantānaṁ purato pāturahosi.

translated: Then the venerable Nāgasena, having heard the messenger’s words, disappeared from the Asokārāma and appeared in the presence of the hundred thousand arahats on the Rakkhita rock in the Himalayas.

translated: Then the hundred thousand arahats said this to the venerable Nāgasena:

translated: “This King Milinda, Nāgasena, is harassing the community of monks with his arguments, his counter-arguments and his questions.

translated: If all the kings in the whole of India were to come and question me, I would answer them all and satisfy them. Go, Reverend Sirs, without fear to the city of Sāgala.”

original: Atha kho therā bhikkhū sāgalanagaraṁ kāsāvappajjotaṁ isivātapaṭivātaṁ akaṁsu.

original: “Tena hi, bhaṇe, bhadantassa ārocethā”ti.

translated: Then the astrologer sent a message to the Elder Āyupāla: “Venerable Sir, King Milinda wishes to see the Elder Āyupāla.”

translated: “Our going forth is for the sake of practicing the Dhamma and living in accordance with the Dhamma. The fruit of recluseship is our highest goal.”
